intro: Polygonatum amabile, commonly known as the sweet flag or yellow flag, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features long, arching leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green or white flowers. Its flowers are typically borne on tall, slender stems and are pollinated by insects. Polygonatum amabile is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
